column4: Hi All!  How do I disable the pc speakers?  There is no option for it in System>Preferences>Sound.
setting the volume to zero doesn't make the effect you want?
setting the volume to zero kills the volume on the external speakers as well.
are you using headphones? What is your scenario?

I have a "new" HP xw4300 workstation on which I've installed Ubuntu 9.10.  It has an internal speaker.  I've plugged in a pair of external speakers.  When I play a sound (say a music file or a movie) the sound comes out of both the PC's internal speaker and the external speakers.  The only output in the sound preferences is 'Internal Audio Analog Stereo'/
Oh, I see. Ubuntu seems to belive there is only one speaker because it is how the audio card behaving. This is an unusual situation. I recommend you trying to ask for help at ubuntuforums.org
That's a good clue.  Thanks.  I'll check the HP website to see if there are specific audio drivers.
I'm quite sure they don't provide drivers for Linux. Have you googled about it? There is probably someone that is facing the same issue you are facing.
I chose this machine specifically because linux was available on it from the manufacturer, so presumably they have drivers.  As for google, I haven't found anything yet.
And what about ubuntuforums.org?
I may have had a few google hits in my search, but I haven't checked directly, no.
if you find nothing that points to a solution on ubuntuforums.org, I suggest you to create a thread explaining your problem and asking for help.
The HP website has alsa drivers for Fedora 3. Off to ubuntuforums...
if it is availuable for Fedora, it is possible if is already working in your Ubuntu install.
Well, the sound is "working", I just can't turn off the PC speakers by themselves.

there are some manufacturers that release drivers for Linux but crappy ones, without working properly. Another thing to consider is that Ubuntu changed to PulseAudio. This may lead to some regressions (stuff that worked in previous versions will stop working)
the best thing you can do at the moment is request for help at Ubuntuforums.org
Working on that even as we speak.
if you don't get any reply in the following week, I suggest you to file it as a bug.
I ran a program called alsamixer.  It gave me a textUI, which had a separate control for the PC speaker.  I've now got it muted without muting the externals.
P.S.  I found the solution on ubuntuforums.org, as you suggested.
is there someone already saying this works on this thread? If there isn't, it is important to you to add a comment stating the procedure works.
The thread is two years old.
There are various posts up until yesterday.  Some say it works.  Some say it doesn't.
